title: Applications Engineer
description: Applications Engineer - Processing/Quoting Location: Madison Heights, MI Summary: The Applications Engineer is responsible for concepting manufacturing processes and analyzing data to assess the time, money, materials, and labor required to manufacture complete BIW tooling systems. Essential Functions Prepare quotes for customer systems based on the supplied process released from engineering Prepare cycle time analysis, conceptual drawings, sequence of operations, and technical descriptions of machine stations and major system components Set estimated margins on all quoted jobs Estimates costs of new equipment or capital investment necessary for production Collaborate with project management to negotiate changes and costs on projects, negotiates these changes with customers, when required Review sketches, engineering data and other RFQ information to determine the items to be quoted Recommend process improvements for estimating and implement new procedures where needed Willingness to assist within other areas of the company regarding component quoting and line processing Other functions as assigned by Management Skills/Abilities Experience with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.) Experience in Processing a plus. Experience with AutoCAD a plus. Experience quoting entire BIW tooling assemblies preferred. Qualifications Required minimum 4 years’ experience in cost estimating or process engineering Required minimum 2 years’ experience within relevant industry Knowledge of manufacturing processes and ability to interpret engineering layouts and data Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to analyze financial data to estimate costs Strong communication and organizational skills, with the ability to multi-task effectively Ability to work effectively and efficiently with minimal supervision Willing to travel locally and long-distance to customer sites to do field checks; if necessary Work Conditions Must be able to work in a professional office environment as well as a manufacturing environment May be exposed to moving mechanical equipment, airborne particles, and occasionally chemical fumes The noise level within the manufacturing floor may be faint to moderate, and occasionally loud Eyewear is mandatory while in the manufacturing area Safety shoes such as hard soled shoes are to be worn in the manufacturing area Must be able to work overtime when required as job permits Physical Demands Must be able to sit/stand for long periods of time if necessary Must be able to bend and lift objects up to 35 pounds if required Bulldog Factory Automation is committed to the policy of ensuring that all persons regardless of sex/gender (including pregnancy), gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, national origin, disability, protected genetic information, protected veteran status, age, religion, or any other protected category under applicable local, state, or federal law, are afforded equal employment opportunities.

title: Software Engineer (Secret clearance)
description: Please review the job details below. Maxar is seeking a cleared Software Engineer in Ypsilanti, MI. We are a leader in the field of signal and image processing. This is an opportunity to work on an integrated team to build innovative software using mathematical solutions to support users in the defense and intelligence communities. Work as part of a team in a lead role designing, implementing, testing, and delivering algorithms for Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and related radar modes. Responsibilities Working on an integrated team to build innovative software using mathematical solutions to support users in the defense and intelligence communities. Working as part of a team that designs, implements, tests, and delivers algorithms for Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and related radar modes. Take algorithm definitions and prototypes and convert them into robust software applications that run efficiently on large images and are ready for operational environments. Apply software standards and processes to produce high quality, extensible, and maintainable software packages. Collaborating with our radar and research scientist experts to solve issues and iterate to improve image product quality. Build and improve on automated test and verification software and tools. Individuals with an interest in learning or growing in any of these areas are encouraged to apply. Minimum Requirements US citizenship Current Secret clearance with the ability to obtain & maintain a TS/SCI clearance. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Applied Mathematics or related technology fields. 2 years of experience in related fields. Strong programming skills in an Object Oriented programming language (e.g. C++, Python). Version control experience in Git (GitHub, GitLab, BitBucket) Preferred Current TS/SCI clearance. AWS Experience. Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes. Other language skills: Java, scripting or similar. Experience with formal software development methodologies. Experience with build tools. #cjpost Skills Our salary ranges are market-driven and set to allow for flexibility. Individual pay will be competitive based on a candidate’s unique set of knowledge, skills, and geographic diversity, with earnings potential commensurate with experience. The range for this position is: $71,000.00 - $119,000.00 annually. Maxar employees must follow all applicable Maxar policies and COVID-19 requirements as well as those of Maxar customers and third parties. Individual job requirements may vary, and Maxar reserves the right to modify its policies and requirements as it deems appropriate in accordance with applicable law. Maxar Technologies values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Center Engineer
description: Job Title: Data Center Engineer Job Location: Marshall MI 49068 Onsite Requirements: data center management or system integration engineering Strong knowledge of Red Hat Linux, Windows Server 2008, and virtual machine operations. Proficiency in maintaining and troubleshooting both hardware and software in data centers. Job Description: Essential Functions: Oversee the daily operations and maintenance of the central and edge data centers. Plan, design, and implement expansions and installations of data centers, networks, servers, and storage devices based on business needs. Troubleshoot and resolve complex hardware and software issues in data centers. Install, configure, and maintain ESXi clusters, including but not limited to Windows and Linux clusters. Monitor and manage data center environments 24/7 to ensure equipment operates safely, efficiently, and reliably. Diagnose and repair hardware problems related to data center environments and servers. Participate in the construction and installation of servers, storage devices, and network equipment in data centers. Handle server host failures and operating system issues promptly. Maintain the data center environment, including emergency management of air conditioning failures. Ensure compliance with network wiring standards and best practices. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, Automation, Electronic Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience in data center management or system integration engineering. Proficiency in maintaining and troubleshooting both hardware and software in data centers. Strong knowledge of Red Hat Linux, Windows Server 2008, and virtual machine operations. Experience in system integration engineering or data center management. Familiarity with server hardware equipment replacement and software service debugging. Ability to diagnose and resolve issues related to servers and data center infrastructure. Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Excellent communication skills, capable of working with cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously. The ability to maintain a full-time work schedule with regular in-person attendance is required for this position. Ability to interact professionally with individuals of varied backgrounds and skill level. Physical Requirements: Ability to move around work sites, which may include walking, standing, and climbing ladders or stairs. Flexibility to bend, kneel, or crouch, particularly when inspecting installations or troubleshooting. Capability to lift and carry moderate weights, typically up to 25-50 pounds. Occasional lifting of heavier items may be required. Ability to work in various environments, including offices, construction sites, and manufacturing facilities. Willingness and ability to travel to various job sites, which may require driving or other forms of transportation. ** 3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply. **

title: •Associate Developer Analyst, Data Engineering
description: As a family company, we serve people and communities. When you work at Meijer, you’re provided with career and community opportunities centered around leadership, personal growth and development. Consider joining our family – take care of your career and your community! Meijer Rewards Weekly pay Scheduling flexibility Paid parental leave Paid education assistance Team member discount Development programs for advancement and career growth Please review the job profile below and apply today! Note: This position is not eligible for student visa (OPT) candidates or visa sponsorship. Remote and hybrid work schedules available, must live within the Meijer 6-state footprint to be eligible for the remote or hybrid work schedule [Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, Illinois, Wisconsin, Kentucky] Or, be willing to relocate. The Meijer MarTech development team is seeking a Developer/Analyst II with experience in data engineering and tool configuration and administration. Developer/Analyst II is responsible for coding, and testing data movement flows and configuring supporting applications; will be capable of solving targeted technical problems on their own and able to work with the team on system performance optimization and interoperability issues. The Developer/Analyst II will work with business product owners, developers, and quality analysts to drive value delivery and will participate in all phases of Agile software development. What You'll Be Doing Codes, tests, and implements data movement artifacts and configures/administers supporting applications. Develops appropriate programs and systems documentation according to SAFe Agile principles and industry standards. Runs unit tests. Monitors test results and takes required corrective action. Competent understanding of both systems and/or business knowledge and able to contribute software engineering advice. Demonstrates the initiative and method for solving different problems and proposes effective solutions for those problems. Assists in the deployment of data movement flows and supporting applications or coordinates, implements, and configures vendor software applications. Collaborates with the Business Product Owner and IT partners to create and refine user stories and acceptance criteria for projects. Aids in systems development planning and monitoring. Understands and practices secure coding techniques and processes while using the Agile framework. Participates in structured walk-throughs, secure coding, and technical reviews. Participates with other IT members, customers and other stakeholders in new product reviews, tests and pilots. Actively participates in all Agile team ceremonies. Assist in production support and maintenance of data movement flows and supporting applications as needed This job role may also provide facilitation of activities for Agile teams within ITS as acting Scrum Master This job profile is not meant to be all-inclusive of the responsibilities of this position; may perform other duties as assigned or required What You Bring With You (Qualifications) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Business Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline or equivalent work experience and technical training is required Minimum 3 years of experience in data engineering development; any tool support and administration or application development experience a plus Working knowledge of Python and SQL a must Experience building data and analytics solutions using Azure ADLS, Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse Analytics is preferred Familiarity with digital marketing domain and/or experience supporting Google Marketing Platform (CM360, DV360, SA360, GAM) and Salesforce MCI/Datorama a plus Experience as a team member on project teams in a cross-functional environment. Experience on Agile teams is preferred. Knowledge of data movement development tools, coding and/or scripting languages and testing. Knowledge and understanding of structured analysis and technical design techniques. Knowledge of database management and file access methods is desirable. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms. Solid teamwork, interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work well on cross-functional project teams and foster team commitment to tasks. Knowledge of agile practices in a cross-functional environment preferred Ability to effectively adapt to rapidly changing technology and apply it to business needs. Ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence. Ability to provide high level of quality and productivity.

title: Battery Research Scientist
description: Job Title: Battery Research Scientist Requirements Good understanding of the equipment set up and lab operation. Experience in R&D Lab. Considerable knowledge in lithium-ion chemistry and battery components. Have good understanding of battery characterization including cyclic voltammetry, electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, common potentiostatic and galvanostatic methods etc.; familiarity with Maccor, LAND, Arbin, Bitrode or other equivalent testing systems. Experience with Liquid Electrolytes, university knowledge on liquid electrolytes and lab experience will be accepted. Experience in lab with coin cell. Considerable writing skills to finish reports and scientific articles with supervision. Work collaboratively with partnering labs and research groups. Education Master's in electrochemistry, material science, mechanical engineering, or related background. Prefer US Citizen due to government funded project.

title: Product Security Engineer
description: Company Description Renesas is one of the top global semiconductor companies in the world. We strive to develop a safer, healthier, greener, and smarter world, and our goal is to make every endpoint intelligent by offering product solutions in the automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT markets. Our robust product portfolio includes world-leading MCUs, SoCs, analog and power products, plus Winning Combination solutions that curate these complementary products. We are a key supplier to the world’s leading manufacturers of electronics you rely on every day; you may not see our products, but they are all around you. Renesas employs roughly 21,000 people in more than 30 countries worldwide. As a global team, our employees actively embody the Renesas Culture, our guiding principles based on five key elements: Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative, and Entrepreneurial. Renesas believes in, and has a commitment to, diversity and inclusion, with initiatives and a leadership team dedicated to its resources and values. At Renesas, we want to build a sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. Join us and build your future by being part of what’s next in electronics and the world. Job Description Renesas is seeking an engineer eager to grow to be experienced in Automotive Embedded MCU and/or SoC development with strong knowledge of cybersecurity and ability to engage with the customer for technical marketing of security solutions. This engineer will provide technical marketing and promotion of Renesas MCU and SoC Security devices and solutions. Responsibilities Include Review/understand cybersecurity specifications and evaluate in the context of customer applications Provide t4echnical support to customers and field application teams on design and development utilizing Renesas cybersecurity products. Provide technical support to customers specifically on Renesas device security mechanisms, usage and troubleshooting Demonstrate system solutions, evaluation boards, starter kits, prototypes and reference designs Create and provide demonstrations and application examples to promote Renesas deice security solutions. Develop supporting documentation (overviews, application notes) to promote MCU security solutions. Attend internal/external training and relevant trade shows. Create training material for customers and field application engineers related to cybersecurity with Renesas solutions. Coordinate with colleagues worldwide. Qualifications Experience in automotive microcontroller-centric or SoC design and/or application development will be a plus. Desire to perform technical marketing leadership responsibilities. Degree in Electrical, Software or Computer Engineering or similar (Masers desired). Background in microcontroller/SoC hardware and embedded related implementations. Background in HSM (Hardware Security Module) implementations. Background in CAN, LIN and Ethernet AVB software design and implementations, emulators. etc. Background with vehicle network analysis tools (CANoe/CANalyzer/Vehicle Spy/etc.) Familiarity w/ ARM processors String communication skills necessary. Willingness to travel domestically and internationally. Additional Information Renesas Electronics Corporation empowers a safer, smarter and more sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. The leading global provider of microcontrollers, Renesas combines our expertise in embedded processing, analog, power and connectivity to deliver complete semiconductor solutions. These Winning Combinations accelerate time to market for automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT applications, enabling billions of connected, intelligent devices that enhance the way people work and live. Learn more at renesas.com. Renesas’ mission, To Make Our Lives Easier, is underpinned by our company culture, TAGIE. TAGIE stands for Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative and Entrepreneurial. Our goal is to embed this unique culture in everything we do to succeed as a company and create trust with our diverse colleagues, customers and stakeholders. Renesas Electroncs is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, committed to celebrating diversity and fostering a work environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.

description: Req ID 71520 | Northville, Michigan (US-MI), United States ZF Active Safety US Inc. *DNP* *CBD* ZF North America Inc. has a job opening for the position of Engineer III - Systems (Developer) based out of its location in Northville, MI. Job Duties: Responsible for system requirements management, configuration management, system design, system validation and system integration of electronic components (e.g., Power Inverter or Power Control Units) used in powertrain systems of Hybrid or Electric vehicles; Analyze, derive requirements into system requirements for definition of components & system architecture and the breakdown of system requirements placed on sub-systems/engineering domains; Support technical discussions with customer; Identify components for implementation of system requirements; Define, develop, design Power Electronic/Inverter system functions; Specification of cooperation of different components/sub-systems for implementation of technical functions; Specification of common interfaces & dependencies between components/engineering domains; Review, negotiate customer requirements/agreements on technical system requirements in DOORS/Codebeamer and support obtaining customer sign-off; Ensure customer/system requirements are linked & ensure requirements are up-to-date; Support definition of proper System Requirements per customer requirements; Collaborate with development to define system architecture per technical requirements and to create system FMEA; Technical contact for System related topics; Support development of safety concepts to achieve functional safety goals; Oversee system configuration definition/releases to ensure HW & SW levels compatible & tested prior to release; Discuss, develop, link software, mechanic & hardware requirements to ensure traceability; Identify, develop alternatives to problems/delays; Provide status updates inclu. escalation topics; Collaborate with hardware, software & systems engineers to implement systems engineering strategies based on V-Model principles; Support troubleshooting & analysis tasks; Support all testing phases & product implementation; Perform feasibility studies; Participate in continuous improvement; and Participate in audits and ensure compliance with ZF QMS, inclu. IATF 16949, A Spice. A hybrid (in-office and telecommute) work schedule is available. Position requires up to 10% travel to domestic and international production plants and/or customer sites to support issue resolution. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or closely related field, plus 2 years of experience in engineering, product development, or related occupations, and demonstrated experience with: Systems engineering for product development; Requirements management process, including customer requirements, system requirements, and domain requirements; Technical architecture and systems design of electronic or mechatronic products; Testing of electronic or mechatronic systems, including simulations, calculations, test case definition, test execution, and test documentation; V Model development process, including its application to different roles and stakeholders; and Performing requirements management including maintaining proper documentation, traceability and tracking of requirement status. Send Resume To: Recruitment@zf.com, reference Position ID No. ZF-683 in the email. Be part of our ZF team as Engineer III - Systems (Developer) and apply now! title: DevSecOps Engineer
description: Description We are seeking a skilled security engineer to support the continued maturation of our security enablement team and improving our customer experience with the companies products and services. The Cyber Security team seeks to provide cyber focused software assurance to all of the business units making immediate impacts to the growth of secure software within our products teams. We help guide teams to manage business risk as they develop world class commercial software solutions for many of our national and global fleet customers. Provide consulting services to all product teams, providing advocacy, guidance and education on code security related problems by leveraging enterprise services across product lifecycles, identifying vulnerabilities and implementing secure solutions. Support ISO 27001 certification preparation with guiding remediation of all software products and services. Ability to compromise, work collaboratively and navigate complex decision making. Work with all regular security and compliance annual activities and education plan for all teams to ensure compliance with corporate policies (Information Security Policy, Code of Conduct, etc.) to deliver plan. Design, develop and test automation components for product and software especially security related. Facilitate getting all known control gaps identified and develop control improvement plans to raise operational maturity in partnership with Internal Controls team as part of GRC processes. Partner with Cyber Defense during incident response for teams, as required. Help define security standards around CI/CD pipelines, SAST/SCA/DAST testing processes, DevSecOps principles. Provide engineering insights for application security issues to product teams. Can triage security problems – whether code-level, infrastructure, or architectural to determine risk. Quickly understand security concerns and propose solutions in collaboration with software engineers. Support and develop automation solutions to improve visibility into security issues. Help teams manage technical debt when situation demand upgrade paths not patches. Consult on API Security, gaining context from product team to guide their policy compliance. Work towards automating security testing in the pipelines with platform teams. Provide deep technical insights on topics like logging, IAM, SDLC, DevSecOps, and the role of software assurance in software engineering culture. Stay abreast of changing threat landscape and security techniques to protect customer data and privacy. Skills GCP, AWS, MS Azure, CI/CD, API, Consumer IAM Top Skills Details GCP,AWS,MS Azure,CI/CD,API,Consumer IAM Additional Skills & Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT management, Cyber Security, Risk Management, computer engineering or any related field 3+ years of cyber security, software engineering, or software product delivery Experience implementing and/or supporting cloud-based platforms in an enterprise environment such as: Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Web Services (AWS). Experience with security testing tools and their use in an SDLC Proficiency with scripting and at least one programming language for automation. Direct experience in delivery of security findings to software engineering teams and consulting on risk priorities for vulnerabilities Nice To Have Qualifications Experience using 1 or more SAST/SCA tools like CheckMarx, FOSSA, 42Crunch or BlackDuck Strong working knowledge of Info Sec policy, global purchasing policies and process, GRC component assessment, controls testing, etc. Strong understanding of the OWASP Top 10 security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques Working knowledge of a variety of regulations, control frameworks, and requirements, such as SOX, NIST 800-53, NIST 800-171, ISO 27001 Working knowledge of API Security Security coding experience with languages like Java, Java Script, Python, Ruby or equivalent Working knowledge of engineering concepts around key management, authorization, Cloud Security etc. Experience in security operations. Experience working with GCP and particularly securing GCP assets and development pipelines. Experience working in incident Response teams to detect, contain, investigate, and recover from security incidents. Familiarity with automation test scripts, test plans and configuration of test systems. Experience working with GAO and/or Internal Control Strong working knowledge of architecture patterns and resources Certifications are highly valued (CISSP, CISA, CISM, etc.) Experience Level Expert Level About TEKsystems We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. title: Planning & Optimization Engineer
description: An exciting career awaits you At MPC, we’re committed to being a great place to work – one that welcomes new ideas, encourages diverse perspectives, develops our people, and fosters a collaborative team environment. Summary: Refinery Value Chain Optimization is looking for a motivated and dynamic Planning & Optimization Engineer. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in regional backcasting, regional optimization, and LP submodel maintenance. The candidate must possess strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills. Core Responsibilities: Coordinates the commercial aspects of refinery operations, including feedstock selection, product and intermediate placement, supply chain optimization, and market analysis. Demonstrate a fundamental understanding of refinery operations, economics, and market dynamics. Develops and communicates strategies that capture missed opportunities and closes production optimization gaps. Assist collaboration meetings with the value chain to discuss both local and regional economic drivers. Develop optimized and executable production plans for a single refinery using linear programming simulation models. Modify production plans as needed to adjust to demand/margin changes. Identifies constraints associated with refinery modeling, uses provided input to develop refinery plans. Conduct detailed analysis of buy-or-make options, considering factors such as cost, quality, supply chain implications, and market dynamics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant data and insights. Assist in developing decision-making frameworks and presenting findings to stakeholders. Analyze historical refinery data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to validate data accuracy and completeness. Assist in developing backcast models and scenarios to evaluate past performance and identify optimization opportunities. Conducts project support cases independently under supervision. Demonstrates understanding of refinery operations and commercial aspects of projects. Able to analyze data, identify issues, and propose solutions with guidance. Collaborates with team members to execute project support tasks effectively. Understands local refinery deliverables and can effectively manage with support of others. Understands how scheduling tools/processes work and is trained on APS to develop local refinery plans. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering required 3 years relevant experience required. Technical Services or Economics & Planning experience preferred PIMS/LP experience is desired Travel Expected: Less than 5% Relocation: Available This position grade may vary depending on candidate experience. The successful candidate will be placed at a level commensurate with experience and qualifications. As an energy industry leader, our career opportunities fuel personal and professional growth. title: Devsecops Engineer
description: Top Skills' Details 3+ years experience providing cybersecurity consulting services to product teams. 3+ years experience triaging security problems; code-level, infrastructure or architecturally related. 3+ years experience supporting API and Cloud security related solutions Job Description This client is seeking a skilled security engineer to support the continued maturation of our security enablement team and improving our customer experience with the company products and services. The Cyber Security team seeks to provide cyber focused software assurance to all of the company business units making immediate impacts to the growth of secure software within our products teams. We help guide teams to manage business risk as they develop world class commercial software solutions for many of our national and global fleet customers. Provide consulting services to all the companies product teams, providing advocacy, guidance and education on code security related problems by leveraging enterprise services across product lifecycles, identifying vulnerabilities and implementing secure solutions. Support ISO 27001 certification preparation with guiding remediation of all software products and services. Ability to compromise, work collaboratively and navigate complex decision making. Work with all regular security and compliance annual activities and education plan for all teams to ensure compliance with corporate policies (Information Security Policy, Code of Conduct, etc.) to deliver. Design, develop and test automation components for product and software especially security related. Facilitate getting all known control gaps identified and develop control improvement plans to raise operational maturity in partnership with Internal Controls team as part of GRC processes. Partner with Cyber Defense during incident response for the teams, as required. Help define security standards around CI/CD pipelines, SAST/SCA/DAST testing processes, DevSecOps principles. Provide engineering insights for application security issues to product teams. Can triage security problems – whether code-level, infrastructure, or architectural to determine risk. Quickly understand security concerns and propose solutions in collaboration with software engineers. Support and develop automation solutions to improve visibility into security issues. Help teams manage technical debt when situation demand upgrade paths not patches. Consult on API Security, gaining context from product team to guide their policy compliance. Work towards automating security testing in the pipelines with platform teams. Provide deep technical insights on topics like logging, IAM, SDLC, DevSecOps, and the role of software assurance in software engineering culture. Stay abreast of changing threat landscape and security techniques to protect customer data and privacy. Additional Skills & Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT management, Cyber Security, Risk Management, computer engineering or any related field 3+ years of cyber security, software engineering, or software product delivery Experience implementing and/or supporting cloud-based platforms in an enterprise environment such as: Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Web Services (AWS). Experience with security testing tools and their use in an SDLC Proficiency with scripting and at least one programming language for automation. Direct experience in delivery of security findings to software engineering teams and consulting on risk priorities for vulnerabilities Nice To Have Qualifications Experience using 1 or more SAST/SCA tools like CheckMarx, FOSSA, 42Crunch or BlackDuck Strong working knowledge of Info Sec policy, global purchasing policies and process, GRC component assessment, controls testing, etc. Strong understanding of the OWASP Top 10 security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques Working knowledge of a variety of regulations, control frameworks, and requirements, such as SOX, NIST 800-53, NIST 800-171, ISO 27001 Working knowledge of API Security Security coding experience with languages like Java, Java Script, Python, Ruby or equivalent Working knowledge of engineering concepts around key management, authorization, Cloud Security etc. Experience in security operations. Experience working with GCP and particularly securing GCP assets and development pipelines. Experience working in incident Response teams to detect, contain, investigate, and recover from security incidents. Familiarity with automation test scripts, test plans and configuration of test systems. Experience working with GAO and/or Internal Control Strong working knowledge of architecture patterns and resources Certifications are highly valued (CISSP, CISA, CISM, etc.) About TEKsystems We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Software Engineer
description: As a family company, we serve people and communities. When you work at Meijer, you’re provided with career and community opportunities centered around leadership, personal growth and development. Consider joining our family – take care of your career and your community! Meijer Rewards Weekly pay Scheduling flexibility Paid parental leave Paid education assistance Team member discount Development programs for advancement and career growth Please review the job profile below and apply today! The ideal candidate for this role has 5+ years of experience. Is that you? This candidate will have hands on technical and applicable knowledge of .NET, Cosmos/Cosmos DB, Service Bus, Azure/ADF pipeline development lifecycle (including deployment) and Azure project implementation experience. If this is you, you will also have a solution first mindset. Understanding bugs, problems and issues should be a part of our drive for excellence; so analysis, the ability to troubleshoot or predict problems are a job requirement and not a nice to have. As a part of an overall cloud solution development team, any candidate with Azure Cloud Architecture, API Development and experience utilizing, and managing these resources would be a huge bonus! You will follow our company software development lifecycle to design, code, configure, test, debug, and document our legacy system and application programs as well as modernizing current applications. You will create or assist in preparing technical design specifications based on functional requirements and analysis documents. You will also review functional requirements, analysis and design documents and provide feedback. You will collaborate with other development staff to achieve and maintain a high level of quality and consistency in our development environments. You will also rely on your experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals independently as well as with a team. You must be able to communicate effectively with audiences with differing levels of technical comprehension and leadership. You will be challenged to be a thought leader. This candidate will have the opportunity to work with different development teams to perform a variety of tasks, research, learn, dig in and coordinate knowledge sharing to the team and more! The ideal candidate will be eager for a challenge! What you GET to do! Develop, test and implement programs and assist in deployment of applications; create and provide robust system documentation TDD (Test Driven Development), Unit Testing, and take corrective action when needed Optimize applications and integral interfaces to meet cross-functional team SLA requirements. Actively participates in all team Agile ceremonies. Use SAFe Agile Framework practices and processes to enable and lead our work flows Assist business partners, stakeholders and customers in systems analysis and creation or updating of documentation for all business processes. Interfaces with the Product Owner and IT partners to develop acceptance criteria for features and user stories and ensures acceptance criteria are met. Performs feasibility studies/proofs of concept to evaluate solutions. Participates in structured code walkthroughs, and technical reviews ensuring application coding and design follows secure coding and design principles. Acts as a thought leader and actively provide feedback. We all have unique thoughts and experiences and those are valuable to provide input, clarity and direction. This job profile is not meant to be all inclusive of the responsibilities of this position; may perform other duties as assigned or required. What you get to show off! (Qualifications): Bachelor’s degree or equivalent level of experience Courage to share your thoughts and feedback with the team and leader about processes, procedure and provide solutions. Ability to strive for excellence and pursue a high level of quality and productivity Experience in design and implementation of IT solutions. Large project a plus. Strong knowledge of development tools, coding and scripting languages, SQL and testing. Knowledge and understanding of structured analysis and technical design techniques. Knowledge of database management and file access methods. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong team-oriented interpersonal and communication skills. Knowledge of Agile practices in a cross-functional environment preferred. Ability to effectively adapt to rapidly changing technology and apply it to business needs is essential. Things You’ll Need Cosmos DB Service Bus ADF (Azure Data Factory) Microsoft Azure cloud tech stacks .NET Extra Credit (1 Ups) DevOps Azure Pipeline What Helps Teams Be Successful Communication Collaboration Critical Thinking Creativity Emotional Intelligence

title: Lab Systems Engineer
description: Job Description Onsite: This role is categorized as onsite. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Estes Engineering Center, Warren Technical Center, MI on a full-time basis. About GM There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors. To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future. This job is based in General Motors’ Warren, Michigan Global Battery Systems Lab (GBSL-W). This facility uses extensive automation to operate 24/7 with two shifts of personnel, covers over 100,000 sq. ft. on the Warren Technical Center campus and has capabilities to test 108 battery packs or modules and 120 battery cells simultaneously. The facility has testing capabilities including traditional environmental testing, vibration, safety and abuse and exploratory development testing. GBSL-W maintains commonality with GM’s battery lab located in Shanghai, China (GBSL-S). The lab and results it produces are used by GM’s growing team of engineers working on advanced batteries and electrified vehicles, in support of the vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. The Role The Lab Systems Engineer (LSE) reports to the Group Leader of Engineering Maintenance and Technical Support (EMTS) and directly supports the development and validation of current and future technologies within General Motors’ portfolio. The LSE is primarily responsible for specifying, sourcing, engineering, integrating, and safely commissioning test equipment within the lab. This role directly affects the quality, durability and performance of vehicles and related products developed by General Motors. The Lab Systems Engineer role is a good fit for a qualified individual who is interested in state-of-the-art technologies and testing methods, system-level integration, and has an interest in electronics, electrical power distribution, and test equipment. This role offers practical, hands-on product development experience. What You'll Do: Maintain a technical focus on Electrical Engineering in support of the EMTs organization. Lead and support projects that specify, source, engineer, integrate, install, and commission new test equipment. Ensure management and stakeholders are aware of progress toward the goal of on-time delivery. Function as a subject matter expert in the G-Risk, G-Comply, Management of Change, and Contractor Safety Management processes as applicable to new test equipment commissioning. Design, development, and validation of test systems to support new test methods. Maintain awareness of the latest test equipment and technology, including commissioning, safe operating procedures, and maintenance requirements Maintain awareness of the product forecast within the broader Product Development community. Ensure planning for the future as it relates to test equipment and related methods to ensure future products can be tested safely, on-time, and with quality. As needed, represent the laboratory within the broader Product Development community Provide support for current test equipment, including troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and development of new test setups and configurations in support of new test requirements. Additional Job Description Your Skills & Abilities (Qualifications): B.S.E. in Electrical Engineering 5+ years of experience in an industrial or laboratory setting High level of interest in the vehicle electrification space Demonstrated ability to work with a high level of autonomy in a complex environment, managing multiple projects by establishing priorities and deliverables with minimal supervision. Experience with equipment used in testing or related products. Experience with test automation systems used in the testing of related products. Experience working with equipment suppliers and installation contractors. Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team. Experience troubleshooting complex systems to resolve multifaceted issues such as: signal quality, signal timing, electrical noise, serial protocols, hardware and software based test systems What Will Give You a Competitive Edge (Preferred Qualifications): 7+ years of experience in an industrial or laboratory setting M.S.E. in Electrical Engineering Experience with GM-specific processes, including Safety Observation Tours, Safety Contract Management, G-risk, G-comply, Design for Health & Safety, and Management of Change Experience purchasing capital equipment and related processes. Product development and/or testing experience. Use of common automotive debug and data acquisition tools Experience designing custom circuitry or hardware to extend or automate the capabilities of common test equipment. Knowledge of traditional product development, validation and release timing, milestones, and methodologies Experience working in an ISO 17025 or ISO 9001 accredited environment. About GM Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all. Why Join Us We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team. Benefits Overview The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others: Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents; Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family; Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement; Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values; Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing; Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends. Diversity Information General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities. Equal Employment Opportunity Statements GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an individual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Software Integration & Test Engineer Autonomous Vehicles
description: KION Group is a leading supplier of forklift trucks and warehouse equipment, as well as integrated automation technologies, and software solutions for the optimization of supply chains. KION Group employs over 42,000 skilled professionals to service its customers globally. Our solutions ensure the smooth flow of materials and information in customers’ warehouses, production plants, and distribution centers in over 100 countries. This position will be part of the Robotic Systems Development (RSD) team within the Central Technology Office (CTO). CTO plays a key role in our organizational structure by bringing together technical expertise and innovation across the KION Group and its Operating Units. RSD explores the cutting-edge robotic technologies we develop and brings innovative solutions to life. Our diverse teams go beyond technology development, providing comprehensive solutions, services, and lifecycle support. We are dedicated to turning the CTO's vision into reality and empowering our operating units to deliver revolutionary solutions to our valued customers. This position is located in Holland, MI. This is a hybrid position requiring three days in-office and two days optional to work from home. What we offer: What we offer: Career Development Competitive Compensation and Benefits Pay Transparency Global Opportunities Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer Dematic provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. The base pay range for this role is estimated to be $65,000 - $140,000 at the time of posting. Final compensation will be determined by various factors such as work location, education, experience, knowledge, and skills. You will have the opportunity to make a direct impact on state-of-the-art technology in a rapidly growing market. You will work closely with a cross-functional team to ensure that our Mobile Automation products meet their requirements and intended use. You will also interact with world-class engineers in an environment that fosters professional development, collaboration, and support at all levels. Our autonomous vehicle software encompasses all aspects of automating vehicles used in intralogistics, from low-level hardware interactions and safety over localization, perception and task execution out to UI and diagnostics. We specialize in the development of integrated systems, the fusion and interpretation of data, and the design and deployment of elegant solutions. As a critical member of the team, you will support the integration and testing of our vehicle software stack in interaction with our product development and validation teams. Work is primarily focused on software system integration and software verification and validation. Responsibilities and learning opportunities include: Discovering, investigating, and solving problems Developing, documenting, and executing test approaches and procedures Conducting hardware, software, and system integration Troubleshooting anomalies Participating in technical reviews and status meetings Crafting test scenarios Performing data analysis Creating, updating, and validating tests and tools in cooperation with the test automation team Assessing compliance to product specifications and international standards Interacting and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders on technical and programmatic issues Tasks and Qualifications: Basic Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor’s degree or higher, with a major in an engineering discipline, computer science. physics, or math (other majors considered with relevant skills/experience) 3 to 15 years of work in a technical environment Required Skills: Ability to manage a dynamic workload in a fast-paced environment with minimal oversight Clear, concise, and correct written and oral communication, including grammar, spelling, and composition High standards of quality and attention to detail Desired Technical Skills: Experience with software and hardware integration methodologies Experience with software and hardware test methodologies Expertise in problem decomposition, root cause analysis, and risk analysis Familiarity with issue & task management systems (eg. Azure DevOps, JIRA) Familiarity with C/C++ and Python Familiarity with Linux and TCP/IP networking and bus communication (eg. CAN) To be successful, you should: Be self-motivated, energetic, tenacious, well-organized, flexible, and thorough Create trust and influence to achieve goals diplomatically Have an analytical eye for noticing inconsistencies and an innovative passion for reconciling them Display creativity, ingenuity, reliable intuition, and well-developed problem-solving skills Ask inquisitive questions and learn from the answers Be able to generalize from examples and apply critical judgment Practice time management and prioritization skills Always consider context and stakeholders Naturally think logically and critically Read and follow directions and standard operating procedures Possess effective interpersonal and teamwork skills, particularly with respect to advocacy and negotiation Handle responsibility well and act on constructive feedback Understand the need for control, repeatability, and risk management and act accordingly and proactively Demonstrate moderated discipline, pragmatic perseverance, scientific curiosity, and measured skepticism

title: Integration Engineer
description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance. Make a meaningful impact by creating bridges that improve healthcare. Modern medicine has hundreds of specializations that depend on data from many niche systems to make informed decisions. In Epic's quest to help healthcare providers deliver the highest quality of patient care, we rely on the Integration Engineers on our EDI team to share information across disparate systems and make it easily accessible within a single patient record. Each project this group of experts tackles presents a unique set of challenges; if you enjoy variety, you've found your sweet spot. Your mission use your coding smarts, analytical skills, existing international standards and your breadth of knowledge to figure out ingenious ways to access, convert, and display this data to the end users of Epic's software. Your know-how won't be limited to the technical realm; both Epic and customer teams will look to you to provide sound advice for implementation strategies and project management. You'll make a positive impact from day one as part of a collaborative and committed team of technical peers, and will enjoy opportunities to grow toward your strengths and what interests you most. More than just important work . Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer.We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO. Bachelor's or greater in engineering, math, information systems, or a related field A history of academic and professional success Strong analytical and reasoning skills Willingness to travel nationwide 10-25% Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed) COVID-19 vaccination

title: Application Engineer
description: Job Description Our people are the life of this company. Together, we build life into the kitchen. We are a nationwide team, designing and manufacturing the most comprehensive choice of kitchen cabinets in the U.S. Our people pride themselves on genuine collaboration, working to deliver a seamless, integrated, quality experience to anyone and everybody. Our shared purpose is to bring the kitchen to life — the place where people spend such a meaningful part of their personal and family lives, and the true heart of any home. title: Application Engineer II
description: Join Xylem in the global mission to #LetsSolveWater! As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Applications Engineer to join our manufacturing team within the water industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in manufacturing processes, a keen understanding of water systems, and the ability to provide technical support and solutions to optimize our products and services. This role involves close collaboration with various departments, including R&D, sales, and customer support, to ensure the successful implementation and performance of our water-related applications. What We Can Offer You Our Total Rewards Program goes far beyond base compensation by providing a more fulfilling work experience and offering a competitive benefits program, including: Health, dental, and vision insurance Unlimited PTO Fertility benefits, adoption assistance, parental leave, and pet insurance Generous retirement savings and profit-sharing plan Employee wellness program Rewards and recognition program Core Responsibilities And Tasks Live our culture and exemplify our Growth Enabling Behaviors to be highly enabled to deliver, highly empowered to succeed and highly accountable to lead. Works primarily with the direct sales team, reviews customer requirements on small to medium complex projects, determines appropriate process solutions by performing calculations using standard tools. Selects appropriate equipment / materials to meet customer needs and to develop project costing. Works with Drafters, creates drawings as required for the application. Generates customer proposals utilizing standard tools, seeks and gains appropriate approval levels. Effectively communicates solution to internal and external customers. Determines and understands risk associated with work product. Assists in mentoring AE I level engineers on business processes and smaller applications. Position Requirements FORMAL EDUCATION: Requires BS/BA degree in Engineering 2+ yrs of experience Knowledge & Experience Advanced knowledge of business tools, processes and procedures. Ability to conduct and understand water quality projections. Competency in multiple standard equipment platforms and their employment. Thorough understanding of common components and their application. Able to execute complex tasks with limited guidance. Effectively collaborates with other disciplines in a team environment. Solid understanding of the sales process and how organizational role influences outcome. General understanding of financial principals as related to tasks assigned. Working understanding of contractual terms and conditions. Additional Details TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: 10% Salary Range $62,000.00 - $99,000.00 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of diversity, equity and inclusion in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world. At Xylem, you'll not only contribute to solving water issues but also have the chance to make a difference through our paid Volunteer Program, Xylem Watermark. We embrace diversity and prioritize our employees' well-being through our DE&I initiatives and Employee Resource Groups (ERG). Proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (including disability and veterans) and Affirmative Action workplace, Xylem fosters an inclusive environment free from discrimination or harassment. Please note that the information in this job description outlines the general nature of the position and is not an exhaustive list of duties. Xylem is dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations to enable all employees to perform their essential job functions. We reserve the right to modify this job description and assign additional duties as needed. Embrace the opportunity to be part of Xylem's transformative journey in shaping the future of water technology! #XylemCareers #GlobalImpact #WaterInnovation

title: Vehicle Motion Controls, SW Engineer (EV & ICE- Propulsion/Chassis)
description: Job Description Ford’s Electric Vehicles, Digital and Design (EVDD) team is charged with delivering the company’s vision of a fully electric transportation future. EVDD is customer-obsessed, entrepreneurial, and data-driven and is dedicated to delivering industry-leading customer experience for electric vehicle buyers and owners. You’ll join an agile team of doers pioneering our EV future by working collaboratively, staying focused on only what matters, and delivering excellence day in and day out. Join us to make positive change by helping build a better world where every person is free to move and pursue their dreams. The Vehicle Motion Controls Software Engineer position involves the design, implementation, and validation of vehicle motion controls software. Responsibilities The primary responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to: Develop, implement, and validate controls and software for current and next generation vehicle motion control technologies Develop, capture, and maintain systems and software requirements Create and/or maintain control feature documentation and calibration guides Design control systems to meet functional, regulatory, safety, and functional safety (ISO 26262) requirements Implement control system design in a model-based environment and C language Conduct detailed validation simulations and testing of control system models and generated code at unit and system level Lead control system implementation planning to meet functional, cost, quality, and timing objectives Troubleshoot vehicle/powertrain functional issues; determine and validate corrective actions and preventative measures Qualifications Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Computer Science or foreign equivalency degree, or a combination of equivalent experience and education 5 years of experience in developing, testing and debugging embedded systems software 5+ years of experience in Matlab/Simulink/Stateflow 5+ years of experience in modeling, simulation and testing 5+ years of experience in Model Based Design, C language and embedded software Preferred Requirements: MS or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Computer Science or foreign equivalency degree Proficient in rapid prototyping tools and environments such as dSpace MicroAutoBox Proficient in version control and source code management tools such as GitHub Working knowledge with in-vehicle calibration development tools (ATI Vision, ETAS Inca, etc.) Familiarity with Agile/SAFe tools and processes Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications Experience with requirements and test case management tools such as Jama Experience with AUTOSAR and service-oriented architecture Experience working with diverse teams and across organizational boundaries to accomplish complex tasks Strong written and oral communication skills Outstanding interpersonal skills You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? title: Application Developer
description: Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers. Job Title: Application Developer FLSA Status: Exempt Department: Client Technology Reports to : Director, Application Development and Quality Assurance Location: Proctor – 166 Who are we? What do we do? Company Overview: Proctor Loan Protector provides comprehensive insurance products and service solutions for financial institutions. While weaving compliance throughout all our applications and technologies, Proctor Loan Protector operates as an extension of our clients, where partnership meets innovation. What’s the culture like at Proctor Loan Protector? At Proctor Loan Protector, we are committed to fostering a workplace that values diversity and personal growth. As we continue to grow and expand, this allows us to offer career paths and opportunities. We are dedicated to ensuring that all our teammates feel valued and work in a fun and rewarding work environment What can I expect from working at Proctor Loan Protector? Fun work environment with a variety of work Being part of a team Career growth Ability to highlight your skills Feel valued Great benefits, pay and culture Tell me more about this role, what would I be doing? Summary As an Application Developer, responsibilities include building and maintaining scalable, predictable, and high-quality applications, as well as building new functionality for existing systems. Essential Duties and Functions: include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Devise or modify current solutions to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time and form of desired results. Prepare detail specifications from which programs and test cases will be written Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities including analysis, development and execution of unit testing Participate in Code reviews by reviewing others code and having their code reviewed by other developers Interaction / communication/ follow through with QA throughout testing phase to facilitate iterative cycle Perform necessary investigation, and analysis to assist in the definition of systems set-up, process control and user support. Participate in planning and troubleshooting of infrastructure migration and upgrades. Execute, review and correct vulnerabilities in software based on vulnerability and penetration testing results. Competencies Planning/organizing—the individual prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently. Interpersonal skills—the individual maintains confidentiality, remains open to others' ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things. Oral communication—the individual speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations and demonstrates group presentation skills. Written communication—the individual edits work for spelling and grammar, presents numerical data effectively and is able to read and interpret written information. Problem solving—the individual identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner, gathers and analyzes information skillfully and maintains confidentiality. Quality control—the individual demonstrates accuracy, thoroughness, and monitors own work to ensure quality. Adaptability—the individual adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events. Safety and security—the individual observes safety and security procedures and uses equipment and materials properly. Ability to work independently, often as the only QAA assigned to a project or new Enterprise Solution. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Required Bachelor of Science Degree in a computer-related field or equivalent work experience Proficient with Microsoft T-SQL, MS Office Suite At least 3 years experience developing and supporting software applications Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to communicate effectively with development staff Preferred Web development or Power Systems experience, as required: Web-Related Technologies XML JSON JavaScript HTML XHTML HTTP CSS VB.NET C# Power Systems Technologies RPG Free, RPG/ILE, RPG/IV, RPG/III, RPG/SQL CLP DB2 for IBM i SQL for IBM i Query for IBM i Physical Requirements Necessary On a Regular Basis Manual dexterity, arm and upper body range of motion sufficient for use of a keyboard, mouse and telephone 7-8 hours per day. Speech and hearing sufficient for in-person and telephone communication 7-8 hours per day. Vision sufficient for use of a computer monitor. Ability to sit at a desk 7-8 hours per day. Repetitive motion Sedentary position Pay Ranges Any posted pay range considers a wide range of compensation factors, including skills, experience, work location and more. We offer competitive pay while still allowing for compensation growth within the position and company. EEO Statement Proctor Loan Protector is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, gender identification or sexual orientation, disability, protected veteran status or any other classification protected under law. title: Site Reliability Engineer - W2
